choices.A: Download a list of external apps from the Manage Google login access section within the app access control page.
choices.B: Download a list from the Accessed apps section of the app access control page.
choices.C: Download a list of external apps from the Settings page within the app access control page.
choices.D: Download a list from the Google Services section of the app access control page.

questions.question_text: Employees at your organization can log into any third party applications they need for work-related reasons by using their Google Workspace sign-in. Your organization's security team has asked you to present a list of applications that have access to the data in your Google Workspace domain. What should you do?

As a team manager, you need to create a vacation calendar that your team members can use to share their time off. You want to use the calendar to visualize online status for team members, especially if multiple individuals are on vacation What should you do to create this calendar?

choices.D: Create a secondary calendar under your account, and give your team “See only free/busy” access.
choices.B: Create a secondary calendar under your account, and give your team “Make changes to events” access.
choices.C: Request the creation of a calendar resource, configure the calendar to “Automatically add all invitations to this calendar,” and give your team “See only free/busy” access.
choices.A: Request the creation of a calendar resource, configure the calendar to “Auto-accept invitations that do not conflict,” and give your team “See all event details” access.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
I have been a Google Workspace Administrator / Deployment for about 7 years lol so I can guarante you option A and C are not right, Calendar Resource is not intented for this purpose, so we are left with option B or D, the only difference between both is to allow members to make changes or not so according to the question "You need a Vacation Calentar that your team members can use to share their time off" meaning they will need editing permissions to the Calendar, meaning? the only viable option is B. 
Also if you need documentation, here is the article, mentioning "Track team members’ vacations schedules and business trip dates.": https://support.google.com/a/users/answer/9308965?hl=en

Selected Answer: B
make change in the event

Selected Answer: B
“Make changes to events” access makes most sense. B

https://support.google.com/a/users/answer/13293412 and scroll to "Create a Team Calendar":
B. Create a secondary calendar under your account, and give your team “Make changes to events” access.

Selected Answer: B
Has to be B. While the test says the correct answer is A, I disagree. You don't purchase an archive license and then suspend the user. You purchase an archive license and then archive the user. Also, per the documentation, an archived user "Can be deleted or unarchived, but not suspended in the Admin console." Point being, if the user is archived, they can't be suspend. I'm going with B.
A or B....B?

questions.question_text: You need to offboard a full team of users at your organization. The organizational policy requires that all data and comments must be retained and available for eDiscovery for at least two years. Google Vault has already been configured. You must determine the most cost effective and flexible approach. What should you do?

choices.C: Move the users to their own organizational unit (OU) and disable access to Google services.
choices.D: Remove the Google Workspace license and transfer files and data
choices.B: Purchase archived user licenses and archive the users.
choices.A: Purchase archived user licenses and suspend the users.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Also voting for A. The question calls for organizational level control and NOT OU level control. A is the right answer in this case.

Selected Answer: A
The user must be assigned a custom role that grants them ability to Manage Exports (View, Download and Delete).
They should not be able to create new exports, therefore Manage Searches is out of the question.
In order to see manage the whole organization's exports, the custom role privileges should be put at the top of the OU structure.

choices.D: Add the Manage Exports and Manage Searches privileges for the user at the top of the organizational unit structure.
choices.C: Add the Manage Exports privilege for the user's organizational unit.
choices.A: Add the Manage Exports privilege for the user at the top of the organizational unit structure.
choices.B: Add the Manage Holds and Manage Exports privileges for the user's organizational unit.

questions.question_text: Your organization's legal department needs to provide access to Google Vault exports for one team member. This team member should be able to view, download, and delete Google Vault exports across the organization. However, this user should be prohibited from creating exports. You must create, assign, and configure a custom role for this user. What should you do?

discussion.content:

Selected Answer: B
Visitor Sharing

Selected Answer: B
B. Enable the ‘Visitor Sharing’ feature, and demonstrate it to the Finance team.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer - B
B. Enable the ‘Visitor Sharing’ feature, and demonstrate it to the Finance team.

Selected Answer: D
I believe the answer should be D. From the Sheet, go to FILE->EMAIL->EMAIL THIS FILE. You can send the file to an email address as a PDF, Excel or a Open Document. If you used Visitor Sharing, the users would be able to edit and comment on the sheet. To be more secure you should send the document to the user through email.

I believe the answer should be D. From the Sheet, go to FILE->EMAIL->EMAIL THIS FILE. You can send the file to an email address as a PDF, Excel or a Open Document. If you used Visitor Sharing, the users would be able to edit and comment on the sheet. To be more secure you should send the document to the user through email.
Answer - B

Selected Answer: D
Think on the case; The case is a Financial Team, sharing with an external Finance AUDITOR. 
The regular figure to share for auditions (more if are finance) is to share "local" files, not collaboration files even if they have Google Accounts. So i think for this case, indeed the proper and most realistic workflow will include the attachment

that do not have a Google Workspace or consumer (Gmail) account

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Visitor Sharing is ok so B seems correct,

choices.B: Enable the ‘Visitor Sharing’ feature, and demonstrate it to the Finance team.
choices.D: Attach the Sheet file to an email message, and send to the external auditor.
choices.A: Allow external sharing with the auditor using the ‘Trusted Domains’ feature.
choices.C: Use the ‘Publish’ feature in the Sheets editor to share the contents externally.

questions.question_text: Your Finance team has to share quarterly financial reports in Sheets with an external auditor. The external company is not a Workspace customer and allows employees to access public sites such as Gmail and Facebook. How can you provide the ability to securely share content to collaborators that do not have a Google Workspace or consumer (Gmail) account?
